title: softmax (and log_softmax) fail for 3D tensors in CUDA
body_html:
First off, thank you for your work on this project.

There is an issue with the new log_softmax and softmax implementations that support dim arguments (as of a806d1a).

The following code works:

v = Variable(torch.rand(2,3,4))
torch.nn.functional.softmax(v, v.dim()-1)

However, running the same code in CUDA mode

v = Variable(torch.rand(2,3,4).cuda())
torch.nn.functional.softmax(v, v.dim()-1)

throws the error

RuntimeError: invalid argument 4: dim has to be 0 for 3D input at /home/janwillem/Cloud/git/probtorch/probtorch/build/pytorch/torch/lib/THCUNN/generic/SoftMax.cu:42

Edit: I just realized that #3245 may already address this issue. If so, feel free to close.

body:
First off, thank you for your work on this project. 

There is an issue with the new `log_softmax` and `softmax` implementations that support dim arguments (as of a806d1a). 

The following code works:
```python
v = Variable(torch.rand(2,3,4))
torch.nn.functional.softmax(v, v.dim()-1)
```

However, running the same code in CUDA mode 
```python
v = Variable(torch.rand(2,3,4).cuda())
torch.nn.functional.softmax(v, v.dim()-1)
```
throws the error
> RuntimeError: invalid argument 4: dim has to be 0 for 3D input at /home/janwillem/Cloud/git/probtorch/probtorch/build/pytorch/torch/lib/THCUNN/generic/SoftMax.cu:42

Edit: I just realized that #3245 may already address this issue. If so, feel free to close.
